comments.body:
Isn't this change wrong? Values not equal to a power of two are explicitly allowed! The manpage says:

> The value must be either a power of 2 of at least 1 sector (where the sector size is the largest sector size of the PVs currently used in the VG), **or at least 128KiB.**

(emphasis is mine)
sorry about that. Thought I understood the issue and the PR. I'll figure out how to revert this (since the github revert button isn't working for me )
No problem. I just noticed this PR when #29295 was closed; I didn't notice the notification there from this PR... (Too bad github isn't sending notification emails when a PR/issue is referenced...)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +36,40 @@  pesize:
    description:
    - The size of the physical extent. pesize must be a power of 2.
    - Since Ansible 2.6, pesize can be optionally suffixed by a UNIT (k/K/m/M/g/G), default unit is megabyte.
    type: str
